Help.#cdata:
Assigns an alter password to a SAS data file. The password allows you to protect 
or replace a stored compiled DATA step program or a DATA step view.

Assigns a read password to a SAS data file. The password allows you to read or 
execute a stored compiled DATA step program or a DATA step view.
Assigns a READ and ALTER password, both having the same value.

Specifies one of the following source options: SAVE (saves source code), ENCRYPT 
(encrypts and saves source code), or NOSAVE (does not save the source code).

ToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies to save the source code.
ToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies to encrypt and save the source code.
ToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies not to save the source code.

Help.#cdata: Suppresses the output of all variables to the SAS log when the value of _ERROR_ is 1.
Specifies that SAS does not create a data set when it executes the DATA step.
Names a view that the DATA step uses to store the input DATA step view.

Names the stored compiled program that SAS creates or executes in the DATA step. 
To create a stored compiled program, specify a slash (/) before the PGM= option. 
To execute a stored compiled program, specify the PGM= option without a slash (/).
Specifies that the values of the key variables must be unique.
Excludes all observations with missing values from the index.
